Here is everything you need to know about requesting parental leave:

**Entitlements & Eligibility:**
- To qualify for Shared Parental Leave (SPL), you must have completed 6 months of continuous employment with the company.
- You and your partner may be eligible to share the available SPL in the first year after the birth or adoption of your child.

**Complete Procedures:**
1. Provide the company with the correct notification at least 8 weeks before starting SPL. Include details like the names of both parents, start and end dates of any previous maternity/adoption leave, expected and actual birth dates, amount of SPL available, amount each parent intends to take, and a non-binding indication of when you expect to take the leave. 
2. Submit this notification to HR.
3. While on SPL, you and your partner are entitled to statutory shared parental pay at a government set rate or 90% of your average weekly earnings, whichever is lower.

**Documentation Requirements:**
- Submit the required notification form to HR at least 8 weeks before starting SPL.

**Timeframes & Deadlines:**
- Provide notification at least 8 weeks in advance to start SPL.

**Important Considerations:**
- Any request for discontinuous SPL will be carefully considered on a case-by-case basis. 
- If the period of leave taken is more than 26 weeks, you have the right to return to the same job or a suitable alternative job.

Sources: [1] Shared-Parental-Leave-Policy.docx · [2] Maternity-Policy.docx · [3] Shared-Parental-Leave-Policy.docx
